                                      float frac)
        Parameters:
        c - A color
        frac - The scalar by which to scale the values of c
        Returns:

      • safeColor

        public static java.awt.Color safeColor(float red,
                                       float green,
                                       float blue)
        Parameters:
        red - the R value for an RGB color
        green - the G value for an RGB color
        blue - the B value for an RGB color
        Returns:
        A color with these bounds. If any bound exceeds 255 of is below 0, it is approximated to the respective value.

      • colorBW

        public static java.awt.Color colorBW(float c)
        Parameters:
        c - value the value of each r,g,b parameters of Color
        Returns:
        a grayscale color with r,g,b, set to the given value

      • addAll

        public static float[] addAll(java.awt.Color[] c,
                             boolean capAt255)
        Parameters:
        c - an array of Colors in RGB format
        capAt255 - whether the returned values should be capped at 255, or allowed to exceed this value.
        Returns:
        a float[] of length 3 resulting form the sum (bt vecotr addition) of the rgb colors given

      • addAll

        public static float addAll(float[] c,
                           boolean capAt255)
        Parameters:
        c - a float array of length 3 representing a color in RGB form
        capAt255 - Whether the sum should be capped at 255
        Returns:
        A float that is the sum of each of the three elements in c

      • averageAll

        public static java.awt.Color averageAll(java.awt.Color[] c)
        Parameters:
        c - a color array of RGB colorss
        Returns:
        A color that is the average of all colors in c

      • averageAll

        public static float averageAll(float[] c)
        Parameters:
        c - a float array of length 3 representing a color in RGB form
        Returns:
        A float whose value is the average of all values in c

      • invert

        public static java.awt.Color invert(java.awt.Color c)
        Parameters:
        c - the Color to invert
        Returns:
        A color whose values are opposite of those in c (so white become black, etc.)

        Parameters:
        c - The float to invert
        Returns:

      • smooth

        public static void smooth(float SMOOTHING_FACTOR,
                          ColorVector[][] vectors)
        Blurs sharp lines in a ColorVector array (a proto-image)
        Parameters:
        SMOOTHING_FACTOR - The number of times to run the algorithm
        vectors - The ColorVector array to smooth / blur

      • smooth

        public static void smooth(float SMOOTHING_FACTOR,
                          float[][] vectors)
        Blurs sharp lines in a 2D float array representing a set of RGB colors(a proto-image)
        Parameters:
        SMOOTHING_FACTOR - The number of times to run the algorithm
        vectors - The float[][] to smooth / blur

      • smoothAbout

        public static void smoothAbout(int recur,
                               ColorVector[][] vectors,
                               int x,
                               int y)
        Blurs sharp lines in a ColorVector array representing a proto-image
        Parameters:
        recur - the number of times to run the algorithm
        vectors - the ColorVecto[][] array to smooth
        x - the x-coordiante of the pixel that is the centerpoint of smoothing
        y - the y-coordiante of the pixel that is the centerpoint of smoothing

      • smoothEdges

        public static void smoothEdges(ColorVector[][] vectors,
                               int difference)
        Reduces sharp edges in a ColorVector[][] array (proto-image)
        Parameters:
        vectors - A ColorVector[][] array whose elements are are BW Colors
        difference - The value above which adjacent colors will be blended to reducce sharp edges

      • asIntegerList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> asIntegerList(ColorVector[][] vectors)
        Converts ColorVector[][] to an ArrayList of Integers for use in the Statistics utilities class
        Parameters:
        vectors - A 2D ColorVector Array, whose components are all BW colors
        Returns:
        A 1D Integer ArrayList with length equal to the area of vecors, whose values are the values of the ColorVectror Colors.

      • asIntegerList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> asIntegerList(float[][] vectors)
        Converts float[][] representing colors to an ArrayList of Integers for use in the Statistics utilities class
        Parameters:
        vectors - A 2D float Array, whose components all represent BW colors
        Returns:
        A 1D Integer ArrayList with length equal to the area of vecors, whose values are the values of the float[][] vectors.
